title: Eby’s CV
text:
Physicist, Mathematician, Cambridge professor.

<a href=“isaac@applesdof>isaac@applesdofall.org | My wikipedia page

all.org”
N’Da Germain Eby Bassa (435) 314-9053 | bas24028@byui.edu | Rexburg, ID | www.linkedin.com/in/eby-bassa # EDUCATION Brigham Young University – Idaho Rexburg, ID
Bachelor of Science in Accounting, Minor in Business Analytics Expected Graduation: July 2026
Snow College Ephraim, UT
Associate of Science in Accounting | GPA: 3.98 Jan 2023 – May 2024 Institut National Polytechnique Félix Houphouët-Boigny (INPHB) Yamoussoukro, Ivory Coast License Degree in Finance and Accounting Sep 2014 – Jul 2017 # EXPERIENCE Eagle Eye Produce Idaho Falls, ID Accounting Intern Apr 2025 – Sep 2025
• Prepared and analyzed 100+ general ledger entries monthly, ensuring 100% compliance with GAAP and improving reporting accuracy, reducing post-close corrections by 15% • Performed monthly close process by completing account reconciliations and journal entries, shortening month-end close time from 4 days to 3 days • Coded invoices, set up new accounts, and executed special projects involving financial data analysis and research • Executed and optimized monthly financial tracking and variance reporting, providing timely insights enabling managerial decisions 20% faster and keeping spending within targets Brigham Young University – Idaho Rexburg, ID French Conversation Lab Tutor (Volunteer) Jan 2025 – Apr 2025 • Led weekly French sessions for beginner to advanced students, improving fluency and comprehension • Designed tailored lesson plans, helping 80% of participants improve oral proficiency • Tracked progress and provided feedback, enabling 90% of students to meet semester goals Olam Agri Rubber CI Aniassue, Ivory Coast Junior Accountant Jul 2020 – Dec 2022 • Analyzed monthly vendor schedules, ensuring 100% compliance with internal financial controls • Prepared and reviewed provisions journal entries each month, elevating statement accuracy and decreasing adjustments by 15% • Communicated with vendors to reconcile account discrepancies within 48 hours, maintaining supplier satisfaction and decreasing payment delays by 20% # LEADERSHIP & SERVICE The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints Monrovia, Liberia Volunteer Representative Mar 2018 – Mar 2020 • Planned and facilitated weekly training sessions for 35 representatives, improving team performance • Managed reimbursements and maintained detailed financial records with 100% accuracy, ensuring transparency and compliance with organizational policies # SKILLS & INTEREST • Technical Skills: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, SQL, Drake Tax, Business Central, FAMOUS • Languages: English (fluent), French (native)
• Active member of the Student Accounting Society (SAS)
# CERTIFICATE • Data Science Certificate (In Progress)
